alert.note: Alert for Santa Fe Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 25 at 1:47PM MST until January 26 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, which will reduce visibilities to under one mile at times. Weather conditions will deteriorate quickly this evening and will be at their worst during the overnight hours. * WHERE...Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of Interstate 25 corridor. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
